intro: Comesperma varians, commonly known as the variable comesperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers that appear in spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats.
